snippet: “Endless,” a 45-minute collection of new music set to video, is streaming via Apple Music, which says additional material is coming this weekend.
abstract: R&B singer Frank Ocean releases 45-minute 'visual album' Endless for streaming exclusively via Apple Music, surprising some fans; Apple hints Ocean may release conventional album as well.

headline.main: Frank Ocean Releases a Visual Album, With More to Come
headline.print_headline: New Ocean Album? He’s Making Progress

snippet: More than 30 major technology and communication companies said on Friday they are joining the U.S. government to crack down on "robocalls," automated, prerecorded phone calls that regulators have labeled a "scourge."

headline.main: AT&T, Apple, Google to Work on 'Robocall' Crackdown
headline.print_headline: AT&T, Apple, Google to Work on 'Robocall' Crackdown

snippet: Apple Music has released new and long-awaited music from Grammy-winning singer Frank Ocean in the form of a 45-minute "visual album."

headline.main: Apple Music Posts New Frank Ocean Video Album
headline.print_headline: Apple Music Posts New Frank Ocean Video Album

snippet: Australia's anti-trust regulator on Friday said it would not grant the country's three biggest banks interim approval to collectively negotiate with Apple Inc to install their own electronic payments applications on iPhones.

headline.main: Australia Denies Banks Interim Approval to Jointly Negotiate With Apple on Payment Apps
headline.print_headline: Australia Denies Banks Interim Approval to Jointly Negotiate With Apple on Payment Apps

snippet: After much anticipation, influential R&B artist Frank Ocean has made waves with the unveiling of "Endless," a new visual album, his first in four years.

headline.main: Frank Ocean Releases New Music, Finally
headline.print_headline: Frank Ocean Releases New Music, Finally

snippet: The talks underline how difficult it has become to operate in the ride-hailing market, where people can book rides from drivers through a smartphone app.
abstract: Ride-hailing firm Lyft has had talks with or made approaches to sell itself to several major companies in recent months, but with no success yet; company has cash cushion of $1.4 billion, but is struggling in highly capital-intensive business.

headline.main: Lyft Is Said to Seek a Buyer, Without Success
headline.print_headline: Lyft Is Said to Seek a Buyer, Without Success

byline.original: By DAVID GELLES and MIKE ISAAC

snippet: As Uber pushes ahead with autonomous taxis, and trucking considers going driverless, too, millions of Americans’ driving jobs are at risk.

headline.main: Uber Speeds Toward a Driverless Future, Putting Jobs in Danger

snippet: U.S. mobile payments company Square Inc posted three new job openings in Europe on Thursday, signalling it is moving closer to ramping up operations in the region through an initial venture in Britain.

headline.main: Square Posts Job Openings Signalling European Expansion
headline.print_headline: Square Posts Job Openings Signalling European Expansion

snippet: Volkswagen is planning further acquisitions in the market for new transportation technologies and services, a leading manager at the German carmaker said, as it seeks to make up ground after its emissions scandal.

headline.main: VW Eyes Transportation Deals to Boost Self-Driving Car Plans
headline.print_headline: VW Eyes Transportation Deals to Boost Self-Driving Car Plans

snippet: It's not an easy movie to watch: Hunters clubbing seals to death and bloodying the otherwise pristine ice of the Canadian Arctic.

headline.main: Rated 'S' for Slaughter? New Film Questions Canada Seal Hunt
headline.print_headline: Rated 'S' for Slaughter? New Film Questions Canada Seal Hunt
